Description: Handle sherd of probably Cypriot pottery vessel, perhaps an amphora; flat, oval shaped in cross section; moulded decoration on top of handle consisting of lotus flower; below, four vertical bands. Fine pink-brown clay with cream slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Schlotzhauer (2012, 190-1, no. Nau 169, pl. 37a-b) considers a local (Egyptian) origin for this vessel but this seems unlikely given the fabric; Greek or rather Cypriot production seems more likely.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (Nau 169)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HB.11)
